label: Letter from John R. Beaty to his wife Melvina, March 13, 1861
description: This letter, dated March 13, 1861, was written by John R. Beaty from Fort Alston, located on North Island, Georgetown District, South Carolina to his young daughter (Isabella) in Conwayborough, South Carolina.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: Fort Alston March 13 1861 My Dear Daughter Your Letter written on Friday reached me on Tuesday. I was glad to hear from you, and to hear that your tooth ache had got well. I want to see you worse than you can guess, and I expect to see you next week. I hope so. I must tell you a secrete [secret], it is only 9 days till the Wedding Day [Anniversary] of me and your Ma, and I want you to pursuade [persuade] her to give you a little party and invite me to it. You see if I don't come. I must write to Edgar now. I do so want to see the Dear Boy. he is so good and loves me so much that I dream about being Home and playing on the carpet with him and Pint and you. Write me another good long letter as soon as you can. Good by be a good child Your Father John R. Beaty
